definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: My son have have a low-grade fever for several day.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子已发了几天的低烧。

sentences.english: What reason can low fever lasting after operation of mammary gland tumour be?
sentences.chinese: 乳腺肿瘤手术后持续低烧会是什么原因？

sentences.english: Vaccines may provoke a low fever and other unpleasant symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 疫苗可能引发低烧和其它不适的症状。

sentences.english: I have had a low fever these days.
sentences.chinese: 这些日子我一直发低烧。

sentences.english: But when back to home, I had diarrhea and ran a low grade fever.
sentences.chinese: 可是回家后就拉肚子兼发低烧，郁闷哦。

sentences.english: Today, that fever is starting to look a lot like the flu.
sentences.chinese: 今天，这场低烧看起来已经很像流感了。

sentences.english: Often, a low-grade fever is actually helping fight off an infection.
sentences.chinese: 通常情况下，低烧实际上在帮助战胜感染。

sentences.english: My son has had a low-grade fever for several days.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子已发了几天的低烧。

definition: to have a high temperature (from illness)/to have a fever
to catch cold/(common) cold/CL:場|场[chang2],次[ci4]/(coll.) to be interested in (often used in the negative)/(Tw) to detest/can't stand
antipyretic (drug to reduce fever, such as sulfanilamide)
to have a high temperature/feverish/unable to think calmly/to emit heat
